snippet: Beginning Monday, Nuclear Regulatory Commission judges will consider numerous challenges to the license renewal application for the Westchester County site’s reactors.
abstract: Nuclear Regulatory Commission will hold 12-day hearing to determine whether opponents of the Indian Point nuclear plant, including the Cuomo administration, have valid arguments against a 20-year extension of operating licenses for the Westchester County site's two reactors; 40-year licenses are set to expire in September 2013 and December 2015, but will remain in effect until the commission makes a final ruling
lead_paragraph: Beginning Monday, Nuclear Regulatory Commission judges will consider numerous challenges to the license renewal application for the Westchester County site’s reactors.

headline.seo: Hearings Set on Renewing Indian Point Reactors’ Licenses
headline.main: U.S. Panel to Hear Opponents of Indian Point Nuclear Plant
headline.print_headline: U.S. Panel to Hear Opponents of Renewing Licenses for Indian Point Nuclear Plant
